title: Nirmal Jain on how IIFL Finance aims to keep cost of capital low even as rates rise - Economic Times
content: Nirmal Jain on how IIFL Finance aims to keep cost of capital low even as rates rise  Economic Times
description: “The bottom of the pyramid the 67% of India's households get only 10% of credit and that shows the potential of this and as they grow in the economy their income grows their potential to borrow will be significantly more. I think for microfinance one big thing that has changed is RBIs reforms and the policy initiatives which are relaxing the norms and I think that will help this sector a lot.”
